bibl.title: Wednesday's Child is Full of Woe or: The Seven Deadly Sins and Some More Too! (Another Apotelesmatikon: P. Med. inv. 71.58.) (Nilus. 1.)
bibl.publisher: OVG. Österreichische Verlagsgesellschaft C. & E. Dworak
bibl.note: 3 figg. et 4 pll. n./bl. et 4 pll. coul.

An iconographical and philological study tracing the birth and development of the Seven Deadly Sins from their Babylonian forebears up to their present-day forms in modern art based on a new interpretation of P. Med. Inv. 71.58 (= S.B. XVIII, 12222).
BRASHEAR William M., Wednesday's Child is Full of Woe or: The Seven Deadly Sins and Some More Too! (Another Apotelesmatikon: P. Med. inv. 71.58.) (Nilus. 1.)
Wien, OVG. Österreichische Verlagsgesellschaft C. & E. Dworak, 1998, 8°, 118 pp., 3 figg. et 4 pll. n./bl. et 4 pll. coul. ISBN 3-7067-0008-5. DM 35.
